knowledge_transfers: SSOT Final Validation Checkpoint: Agent-2 executed comprehensive validation of 1,801 files - 1,040 valid (57.75%), 761 invalid (42.25%). 12 domains missing from SSOT registry affecting 146 files: trading_robot (47), communication (30), analytics (28), swarm_brain (9), data (9), performance (6), safety (5), qa (4), git (3), domain (3), error_handling (2), ai_training (1).

Domain Registry Gaps: High-compliance domains (web 100%, messaging 100%, integration 98.7%, infrastructure 98.8%, core 94.2%) show strong SSOT compliance. Zero-compliance domains require registry updates before re-validation.

Remediation Plan: Phase 1 - Agent-8 updating SSOT domain registry (12 missing domains), Phase 2 - Re-validation after registry updates, Phase 3 - File-level remediation for invalid files in high-compliance domains.
Final Checkpoint Documentation: Created comprehensive summary document (docs/SSOT/FINAL_VALIDATION_CHECKPOINT_SUMMARY.md) with domain statistics, invalid files by domain, and remediation planning.

tools_created: tools/parse_validation_report.py - Parses SSOT validation checkpoint JSON report and extracts key statistics (total files, valid/invalid counts, domain statistics, invalid files by domain)
lessons_learned: Validation checkpoint documentation requires comprehensive domain analysis: Domain statistics, invalid files by domain, and remediation planning are essential for actionable next steps
Domain registry gaps significantly impact validation success rates: 12 missing domains caused 146 files (8.1% of total) to fail validation - registry updates are critical before re-validation
High-compliance domains show strong SSOT adoption: Core domains (web 100%, messaging 100%, integration 98.7%, infrastructure 98.8%, core 94.2%) demonstrate successful SSOT tagging implementation
Remediation planning requires phased approach: Domain registry updates → re-validation → file-level remediation ensures systematic resolution of validation issues
